body:
You don't have the right to stop paying rent - even if your landlord has not carried out repairs. Your landlord could evict you if you don't pay rent. 

If you have told your landlord about the need for repairs, then you may be able to take the cost of getting the work done out of your rent. However, this should only be used for minor repairs. Read more about this on the Shelter website: [https://england.shelter.org.uk/housing_advice/repairs/doing_the_repairs_if_your_landlord_wont](https://england.shelter.org.uk/housing_advice/repairs/doing_the_repairs_if_your_landlord_wont)

If you'd like to find out about addressing another issue with your home, you can continue.
heading: Stopping rent payments or taking money from your rent is very rarely advised
